description:
Summary The first step to writing code is to first get it to work both syntactically and scientifically, and later to make it work fast. This lecture will cover both aspects: first the use of a /debugger/ to identify and fix broken code, and then the use of profiling tools to identify which parts of working code be improved for speed or memory usage.
Slides as PDF  This browser does not support PDFs.
title: Debugging and Profiling Scientific Software

description:
Summary Matplotlib is a library to create high quality plots using python.
This lecture gives broad and general introduction into creating plots, exporting them to files, doing animations, and show some example of more complex figures.
We will also introduce the matplotlib pgf backend, which allows producing plots using a LaTeX system, resulting in plots that are matching the look and feel of your LaTeX documents.
Notebooks The notebook is stored in the Git repository: https://github.
title: Matplotlib
